result.name: A comprehensive characteristics of candidate genomic regions for canine monogenic disorders of sex development
result.description: Disorders of sex development (DSD) are congenital conditions in which the chromosomal, gonadal or phentypical sex is atypical. The DSD are usually responsible for sterility or infertility and thus their occurrence in domestic animals is considered as an important breeding problem. The aim of the project is searching for the causative mutations in  DSD dogs using whole genome sequencing, ddPCR and Sanger sequencing techniques.
result.center: Poznan University of Life Sciences, Poznan, Poland
